summary: This document is the curriculum vitae of Robert P. Kelso, a computer forensics expert and private investigator. It details his certifications, education, extensive history of providing expert witness testimony in numerous court cases, professional appointments, and work history. The document appears to be an exhibit, likely submitted as part of a legal proceeding to establish his qualifications.

locations: University of Colorado in Boulder, Colorado
keyFacts: Robert P. Kelso is a highly qualified computer forensics expert with multiple certifications (CHFI, EnCE, ACE) and is a licensed private investigator in Colorado and Texas.
He has an extensive history of providing expert witness testimony in over 40 listed court cases across multiple states and federal jurisdictions, involving civil, criminal, and family law matters.
Kelso has been appointed as a Special Master by United States Magistrate Judges and state district courts on several occasions.
He was selected by the Republican National Committee to act as a local computer forensics expert on call for voter machine security issues during an unspecified election period.
His professional experience includes being CEO of Forensic Pursuit, LLC, and previously working as a software engineer for Lockheed Martin Astronautics and MatchLogic, Inc.
